benchmark_details.name: MAVEN -FACT (Massive Event Factuality Detection)
benchmark_details.overview: MAVEN -FACT is a large-scale event factuality detection dataset containing factuality annotations for 112,276 events. It aims to provide high-quality data for assessing the factuality of textual events and incorporates supporting evidence for improved interpretability.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research in event factuality detection and improve the understanding of event knowledge.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Language coverage is limited to English, and the annotation approach may introduce noise, although mitigation strategies are in place.

data.annotation: Annotated by a combination of LLM pre-annotation followed by human verification, ensuring high quality.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score calculated based on precision and recall across multiple factuality categories.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in distinguishing event factuality.
methodology.baseline_results: Best-performing model achieves a 47.6% macro F1 score.

targeted_risks.harm: Research indicates potential for reducing hallucination in large language models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is collected from public sources and anonymized, with no personal information included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: MAVEN -FACT released under CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
